title: Maharashtra government formation: SC to hear plea of Sena, Congress and NCP at 11.30 am tomorrow
content:
9.36 pm: The Supreme Court will hear the joint petition filed by the Shiv Sena, the Nationalist Congress Party and the Congress at 11.30 am on Sunday, ANI reports.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Supreme Court to hear on tomorrow at 11.30 am the joint plea of Shiv Sena, Nationalist Congress Party and Indian National Congress against the decision of Maharashtra Governor inviting Devendra Fadnavis to form the government on November 23. pic.twitter.com/Be4lMgmSNH‚Äî ANI (@ANI) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    9.05 pm: Congress leader and former Maharashtra Chief Minister Ashok Chavan has accused Devendra Fadnavis of misleading the governor, and asked him to quit, reports PTI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    9.04 pm: Congress leader KC Venugopal says the party‚Äôs 44 MLAs ‚Äúare intact‚Äù, reports ANI. ‚ÄúMaharashtra Governor has bypassed all norms and regulations,‚Äù he tells reporters. ‚ÄúWithout any verification, he invited BJP to form government. We have moved Supreme Court. We will also raise this issue in Parliament.‚Äù 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Congress leader KC Venugopal on Maharashtra govt formation: Our 44 MLAs are intact. Maharashtra Governor has bypassed all norms&regulations. Without any verification, he invited BJP to form govt. We have moved Supreme Court. We will also raise this issue in the Parliament. pic.twitter.com/E3WoMDXuvc‚Äî ANI (@ANI) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.40 pm: Seventeen MLAs of the NCP are missing from the party meeting in Mumbai, say reports.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.22 pm: Dilip Walse Patil is set to become the new NCP Legislative Party leader, News18 reports. Ajit Pawar was sacked after he supported the BJP to form government in the state. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    8.15 pm: At least seven Nationalist Congress Party legislators who attended the swearing-in ceremony of Bharatiya Janata Party leader Devendra Fadnavis as the chief minister of Maharashtra early on Saturday morning have returned to the party fold, PTI reports.Read more here:Maharashtra: At least seven NCP MLAs who attended Fadnavis‚Äô oath ceremony back in party, says report
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.43 pm: The Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress‚Äô petition has not yet been filed, Bar and Bench reports. It says the lawyers are waiting for registry officials at the Supreme Court.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Lawyers are waiting for registry officials at the Supreme Court. Petitioners Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress. Sources Indicate that Devendra Fadnavis and Ajit Pawar will be made parties too. @ShivSena @Dev_Fadnavis @INCIndia @ncpspeaks @AjitPawarSpeaks @PawarSpeaks #MaharashtraCM‚Äî Bar & Bench (@barandbench) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.28 pm: Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi leader Prakash Ambedkar indicates a connection between Sharad Pawar‚Äôs recent meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the current political situation in Maharashtra, News18 reports. ‚ÄúSome leaders of the NCP met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and [BJP chief] Amit Shah,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThe purpose was stated to be to discuss issues concerning rain-hit farmers. Two days ago, Maharashtra governor announced compensation to farmers. The perception that something was fishy started developing from that point.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7.06 pm: The petition also asks for the floor test to be done within 24 hours so as to prevent any further horse-trading.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    7 pm: The petition claims Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari acted in a ‚Äúpartisan manner and has made a mockery of the high office‚Äù. His actions were a ‚Äútextbook example of the governor acting at the behest of a political party‚Äù that is in power at the Centre, the petition claimed. ‚ÄúUnfortunately, the facts in this case demonstrate that the governor has belittled the constitutional office of the governor and has allowed himself to be a pawn in BJP‚Äôs illegal usurpation of power.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.38 pm: The Shiv Sena, Nationalist Congress Party and the Congress will file a petition in the Supreme Court seeking to quash the governor‚Äôs decision to invite Devendra Fadnavis to form government, News18 reports. The move was unconstitutional and illegal, the petition says.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.25 pm: ‚ÄúEven before the people of Maharashtra could wake up from their sleep, the President‚Äôs rule was revoked and the chief minister and the deputy chief minister were sworn-in,‚Äù CPI general secretary D Raja says, according to PTI. He adds that it gave rise to critical questions about the governor‚Äôs role in the state.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.23 pm: ‚ÄúThe BJP has manipulated the situation with all powers at its command to grab power,‚Äù the Communist Party of India says in a statement. It also called the situation in Maharashtra a ‚Äúmockery of democracy‚Äù, PTI reports.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.21 pm: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) accuses the BJP of sordid manipulation, PTI reports. ‚ÄúSordid manipulations for grabbing power,‚Äù the CPI (M) says in a statement. ‚ÄúThe political immorality of the BJP has reached its nadir. The clandestine manner in which the chief minister and deputy chief minister of Maharashtra have been sworn-in shows the extent to which the BJP can stoop to grab power.‚Äù‚ÄúIt is unfortunate that both the constitutional authorities ‚Äì President‚Äôs office and the Governor‚Äôs office ‚Äì have been misused to achieve their political purpose,‚Äù it adds.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.19 pm: NCP workers raise slogans against Ajit Pawar in Thane, PTI reports.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.13 pm: Uddhav Thackeray assures MLAs that the Shiv Sena will come to power in the state, reports News18. He met party MLAs at a hotel in Mumbai on Saturday evening.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    6.10 pm: Reports claim that four of the nine MLAs who were reportedly with rebel NCP leader Ajit Pawar have now returned to the party‚Äôs fold. The four MLAs are Dilip Bankar, Sunil Shelke, Sunil Bhusara and Sanjay Bansode, according to News18.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.46 pm: NCP MLA Dilip Rao Bankar, who was believed to have been on Ajit Pawar‚Äôs side, says that he is with Sharad Pawar and that he only went to the Raj Bhavan because the rebel leader asked him to.

    5.43 pm: Mehbooba Mufti‚Äôs daughter Iltija takes a jibe at the BJP. ‚ÄúMystery of Raj Bhavan fax machines. They work at 5:27 am to revoke President‚Äôs rule facilitating a BJP-led government but went defunct in November 2018 when PDP, NC and Congress tried to stake claim in J&K,‚Äù she writes. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Mystery of Raj Bhavan fax machines. They work at 5:27 am to revoke Presidents rule facilitating a BJP led government but went defunct in November 2018 when PDP NC & Congress tried to stake claim in J&K. New digital India üáÆüá≥‚Äî Mehbooba Mufti (@MehboobaMufti) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.40 pm: Former Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy says only opportunist politics were underway in India these days, News18 reports. ‚ÄúGovernment is being formed with the NCP that had worked against the BJP,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúNo one in this country‚Äôs politics have morality left in them, and no one can discuss about morality, including me.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.35 pm: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala asks why Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari had not mentioned how long the Devendra Fadnavis government had to prove its majority in the state Assembly. He also raised a number of questions about the circumstances leading to Koshyari‚Äôs recommendation to the Centre to withdraw President‚Äôs Rule in the state, and invite Fadnavis to form the government with the support of rebel Nationalist Congress Party leader Ajit Pawar.Read more here:Maharashtra: ‚ÄòHow and when did governor verify BJP‚Äôs claims of support?‚Äô Congress has 10 questions
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.28 pm: Dhananjay Munde visits NCP headquarters in Mumbai to attend a party meeting, NDTV reports. He was believed to have been among the rebel MLAs supporting Ajit Pawar.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.23 pm: Singh adds that the governor‚Äôs role has become that of a ‚Äúgatekeeper‚Äù who is saluting those in power. ‚ÄúRaj Bhavan has turned into Raja Bhavan,‚Äù he says. He also asks how the government was formed when the BJP and the rebel leaders do not seem to have the numbers.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.20 pm: ‚ÄúThe way the government was formed in Maharashtra is undemocratic and it disrespected the mandate of the people of the state,‚Äù senior Aam Aadmi Party leader Sanjay Singh says, according to PTI. ‚ÄúThe dark act that took place in Maharashtra in the dark of night is the act of killing the dignity of democracy of this country.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5.15 pm: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticises BJP for the political situation in Maharashtra.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    SP Chief Akhilesh Yadav on #MaharashtraGovtFormation: Ab to lagta hai ki, 'jiska Governor uski Sarkar'. pic.twitter.com/XJsNi3dZaA‚Äî ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    5 pm: ‚ÄúThe Fadnavis dispensation will provide a stable government in the state. The country has witnessed what has happened and what is happening...Development, not power, will be the agenda of this government,‚Äù Giriraj Singh adds. ‚ÄúThe government will work towards the completion of pending works without selfishness in the interest of the country. My best wishes to the people of Maharashtra which will benefit from this government.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.55 pm: Union minister Giriraj Singh defends the BJP. ‚ÄúThe country has seen that the BJP won 105 seats [in Maharashtra],‚Äù Singh says, according to PTI. ‚ÄúBalasaheb Thackeray had said that in democracy a party with majority gets the post of chief minister. We respect Balasaheb Thackeray and democracy.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.47 pm: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray is meeting his party MLAs at Hotel Lalit in Mumbai, News18 reports.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.45 pm: Ajit Pawar holds meeting with NCP leaders Sunil Tatkare, Dilip Walse Patil and Hasan Mushrif, ANI reports.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Mumbai: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar is holding a meeting with NCP MP Sunil Tatkare and NCP MLAs Dilip Walse Patil and Hasan Mushrif at his brother Sriniwas Pawar's residence; Security has been heightened outside the residence of Sriniwas Pawar pic.twitter.com/KDzv2WOKpG‚Äî ANI (@ANI) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.21 pm: Fadnavis assures party workers that the BJP will complete a full term.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Mumbai: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis arrives at state BJP office. pic.twitter.com/EAxmnl1K0K‚Äî ANI (@ANI) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.20 pm: Meanwhile, Devendra Fadnavis addresses party workers in Mumbai.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.17 pm: Congress puts up 10 questions to the BJP and claims it is on behalf of Indians. Congress spokesperson RS Surjewala asks who presented the claim to form government by the BJP and how many MLAs from the BJP and the Nationalist Congress Party signed the claim to form government.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.15 pm: ‚ÄúIn the history of independent India, this may be the only occasion when in the dead of the night, constitution was subverted, democracy was throttled and rule of law was mowed down by governor to surreptitiously induct an illegitimate govt of the BJP,‚Äù adds Surjewala.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    In the history of independent India, this may be the only occasion when in the dead of the night, constitution was subverted, democracy was throttled and rule of law was mowed down by Governor to surreptitiously induct an illegitimate govt of the BJP: @rssurjewala‚Äî Congress Live (@INCIndiaLive) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.10 pm: They have actually betrayed the people of Maharashtra, Surjewala says. He adds that before the elections, Devendra Fadnavis and BJP had promised to send Ajit Pawar to prison in connection with the irrigation scam. ‚ÄúBut post elections, they have sent him to Mantralaya as a deputy CM. This is only possible in Modi regime. Hence they say ‚Äòmodi hai toh mumkin hai‚Äô.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.09 pm: ‚ÄúAfter scaring an opportunist Ajit Pawar of putting him behind bars, BJP constituted an illegitimate government in Maharashtra by acting as a contract killer for democracy,‚Äù Surjewala says. ‚ÄúBJP and Ajit Pawar have together acted like Duryodhana and Shakuni to rip off and cheat a democratic mandate given by the people of Maharashtra.‚Äù 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.08 pm: ‚ÄúNovember 23 shall go down in the history of India as a black chapter when an illegitimate government was constituted by a governor acting as a hitman on Constitution of India at the instance of a home minister who considers constitution as his captive instrument,‚Äù says Surjewala.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.06 pm: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala claims the BJP threatened Ajit Pawar.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    4.03 pm: Rajasthan Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot seeks the resignation of Maharashtra governor.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    The details that are emerging from #Maharashtra are shocking n shows Governor acted in connivance with BJP n administered the oath of office to Devendra Fadnavis ji without verifying signatures of NCP MLAs. Governor must resign on moral ground. He has no right to remain in office‚Äî Ashok Gehlot (@ashokgehlot51) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.59 pm: ‚ÄúThe people of the country are watching the developments and what type of politics the desperate BJP is playing to form the government,‚Äù Mir adds, according to PTI.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.58 pm: ‚ÄúAjit Pawar had not taken the signatures separately to be part of the BJP-led government,‚Äù Mir says, adding that the governor did not question Pawar about when he held a meeting with party MLAs and sought their support. ‚ÄúIn other places, the governor is seeking parade of the MLAs instead of honouring their signatures and in Maharashtra, the oath was administered by entertaining the fake document,‚Äù he adds.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.57 pm: ‚ÄúOn the one hand, the governor is seeking assurance from the major parties that they have numbers to form the government and on the other he is administering oath just after getting a fake piece of paper [from NCP leader claiming support of the MLAs],‚Äù GA Mir says.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.55 pm: Jammu and Kashmir Congress President GA Mir takes a potshot at the BJP and criticises it for aligning with Ajit Pawar, whom it had earlier accused of corruption, PTI reports.‚ÄúThe country is watching the developments in Maharashtra and perhaps this is the first of its kind drama which was enacted to grab power by the desperate BJP,‚Äù Mir says. ‚ÄúThe leader [Ajit Pawar] was accused of being most corrupt by the BJP till yesterday. The BJP had purified him by its ‚ÄòGanga Jal‚Äô during the night.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.45 pm: Rebel NCP MLAs will be taken to New Delhi, reports India Today.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.39 pm: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh says it was the prerogative of the governor to invite Devendra Fadnavis to form government. ‚ÄúAt this point of time in this programme, I do not wish to make any political statement,‚Äù Singh says at an event in Lucknow, according to PTI. ‚ÄúThe governor invited the person [to form the government] after he was satisfied.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.37 pm: Congress MLAs may be shifted to Jaipur or Bhopal, say reports. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.30 pm: Meanwhile, Raut claims that Ajit Pawar had been ‚Äúblackmailed‚Äù into joining hands with the saffron party, and might return to the Sharad Pawar-led party. ‚ÄúNCP leader Dhananjay Munde has been contacted,‚Äù the Rajya Sabha MP tells reporters in Mumbai. ‚ÄúAjit Pawar may also return [to NCP fold]. We have information how Ajit Pawar has been blackmailed and will expose this soon.‚Äù ‚ÄúOf the eight MLAs who had gone with Ajit Pawar, five of them have come back,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThey were lied to, put in a car, and sort of kidnapped. If they [BJP] have the courage, let them prove their majority in the Assembly.‚ÄùRead more here:‚ÄòBetrayal‚Äô, ‚ÄòAjit Pawar stabbed us in the back‚Äô: Congress, Sena react to Maharashtra developments
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.25 pm: Prasad also refuses to comment on the infighting with the NCP. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.23 pm: ‚ÄúWe are ashamed at the language used by the Shiv Sena for the prime minister and the home minister in their editorial mouthpiece Saamana,‚Äù Prasad says, according to NDTV. ‚ÄúIt is shameful and a new low for their party. We will not stoop to that level. We will make no comments about their leaders.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.21 pm: He adds that the BJP and Ajit Pawar will prove their majority in the Assembly.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.20 pm: Prasad says many people are questioning the role of the governor. ‚ÄúHe called BJP, Sena and NCP, no government was formed,‚Äù Prasad says. ‚ÄúBut this morning, he called the BJP and Ajit Pawar to form a government and they did. No one countered the numbers with the governor.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.15 pm: ‚ÄúBala Saheb [Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray] was always against Congress,‚Äù says Prasad. ‚ÄúBJP‚Äôs ideology was always at par with his and hence we came into alliance with Sena.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.10 pm: ‚ÄúIt was a conspiracy to control the financial capital of India through backdoor means,‚Äù claims Prasad. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.08 pm: The country is entitled to know how there was a ‚Äúmatch fixing‚Äù to grab the chair despite the NCP and Congress saying that they had got the mandate to only sit in the Opposition, Prasad adds. ‚ÄúWhen Shiv Sena breaks a 30-year-old alliance and sides with the opposition, isn‚Äôt that the murder of democracy,‚Äù he asks. ‚ÄúBut they say that Ajit Pawar allying with BJP is murder of democracy.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.07 pm: ‚ÄúIt was the moral and electoral victory of the BJP-led alliance under the leadership of Devendra Fadnavis. It is important to understand this,‚Äù says Ravi Shankar Prasad.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.04 pm: Union minister Ravi Shankar Prasad says Devendra Fadnavis had the people‚Äôs mandate and he was always the ‚Äúrightful chief minister‚Äù.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    3.03 pm: Bharatiya Janata Party‚Äôs press conference begins.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    2.59 pm: Senior Congress leader Ahmed Patel says ‚ÄúToday was a black spot in the history of Maharashtra.‚ÄùRead more here:Maharashtra crisis: Congress says it will fight new BJP-led government ‚Äòpolitically and legally‚Äô
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    2.50 pm: BJP leader and Union minister Nitin Gadkari congratulates Fadnavis on taking oath. He also says: ‚ÄúI had earlier said anything can happen in cricket and politics, now you can understand what I meant.‚Äù
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Union Minister & BJP leader, Nitin Gadkari on #MaharashtraGovtFormation: I had earlier said anything can happen in cricket and politics, now you can understand what I meant. pic.twitter.com/Lv9Gc65tKQ‚Äî ANI (@ANI) November 23, 2019



        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    2.42 pm: Nationalist Congress Party MLAs Rajendra Shingane, Sandip Kshirsagar and Sunil Bhusara claim that they were taken to the Raj Bhavan, ANI reports.
